content: this pattern is written in uk crochet terms us terms translation given on page 9 term uk stitch us stitch chain/s chain/s slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch used in the join as you go jayg method to join the current square to a previously worked square insert hook into adjoining space on previous square yarn over and pull through space and you ll only need to follow the first 3 rounds of the tutorial make a total of 672 squares using colours as given in the blanket squares layout on page 7 ✽ please also read the joining section below before you begin 4ch slip_stitch to 1st chain to make a loop round 1 4ch 3tr into loop 2ch 3 times 2tr into loop slip_stitch into 3rd chain of beg 4ch round 2 slip_stitch into space 4ch 3tr in same space 1ch * 3tr 2ch 3tr into next space 1ch * repeat from * to * twice more 2tr into starting space slip_stitch into 3rd chain of beg 4ch round 3 slip_stitch into space 4ch 3tr into same space *1ch 3tr in 1ch space 1ch 3tr 2ch 3tr into corner space repeat from * to * twice more 1ch 3tr in 1ch space 1ch 2tr into starting space slip_stitch into 3rd chain of starting 4ch joining this blanket is constructed using the join as you go jayg technique this technique will require some of the chain stitches in round 3 to be replaced with joining slip stitches jss in order to join each square to a previous square in the blanket for a full photo tutorial using this technique please see join as you go jayg technique under the tutorial links on page 2 ✽ if you would like to make the squares separately and use another joining method you can find a breakdown of square colours page page 7 border for a full photo tutorial of this border pattern please see giant granny patches border under
